entry.title: Notify navigation state changed when history intervention disabled by user activation
entry.content:
Before this CL, NavigationStateChanged was not called in cases where a

user activation disables the history manipulation intervention,

even though CanGoBack might change from false to true. As a result,

the back button state might not be correctly updated.



This CL triggers a navigationStateChanged after an entry's skippable

bit is updated, if the value of CanGoBack changes as a result..



Bug: 1477784

entry.title: Shortcuts: Fix failed to read unregistered pref: accelerator.override
entry.content:
When kShortcutCustomization flag is false, AshAcceleratorConfiguration

won't register the kShortcutCustomizationOverrides.



But Shell::Get()->accelerator_prefs()->IsCustomizationAllowed() may be

true because it can be set to be true by admin policy.



This will cause a crash because the code will try to read an unregistered pref: accelerator overrides.



http://screen/B4gumWbWqHqk2Dy

entry.title: [CVV Storage] Fix UpdateCreditCard with updated empty CVC
entry.content:
Change the logic when new CVC is empty:

Delete CVC record if the new CVC is empty

Every time the new CreditCard's cvc is empty, we will delete the CVC

record, thus we can ensure that existing CVC records are not empty.

(empty CVC in read-out CreditCard object == empty CVC record)



Unchanged when new CVC is not empty:

Insert if old CVC empty (Empty CVC record)

Update if old CVC is not empty (We do have old record in webdatabase)



Problem:

User have a existing card, then user update the card with empty CVC, then user try to update the card CVC again, Chrome will crash.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vJs3wU8gmPReGITy9FoBhKQs7vwx_0Nv/view?usp=drive_link



Cause:

old_credit_card.cvc is empty doesn't mean it doesn't exist in local_stored_cvc table. We should not use old_credit_card.cvc is empty to determine the logic to insert or update cvc into local_stored_cvc table.



Change-Id: I294743eceecb85b07b35911978636d6ce2213a12

Bug: 1473181

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4791731

entry.title: Resume RequestSession flow after scanning cardboard QR Code
entry.content:
Adds infrastructure to resume the RequestSession flow after scanning the

Cardboard QR Code. When the QR Code activity is finished, our activity

gets resumed, which we can use to resume the request session flow. Since

we are only notified of the activity resume in Java, we have to make a

helper object to begin listening to these events, which can then forward

the status along to native code and then to a subscribed handler. This

infrastructure can be used further in the future to attempt to pause

and resume a session during the "switch viewer" flow, which does the

same thing.



Bug: 1429091

Change-Id: I91deae12a978c3baf0b3820f890f924896e5fb81

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4836426

Reviewed-by: Piotr Bialecki

Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1191651}

entry.title: webauthn: fix hmac-secret with PINv2.
entry.content:
First, as noted in the bug, CTAP 2.1 requires that the PIN protocol be

duplicated into the hmac-secret extension when it's not one, but we

weren't doing that.



Secondly, when decrypting the response, we checked that the correct

number of salts were being returned by checking the length of the

encrypted response, but PINv2 has ciphertext expansion.



(There were also a number of assumptions about how PINv1 worked baked

into the virtual authenticator code, but that doesn't affect any users,

only tests.)



Fixed: 1477486

Change-Id: I96c278d1ec6952a83baec74d8a2f236423f57831

entry.title: [ios] Add updateMagicStackOrder ContentSuggestionsConsumer API
entry.content:
This consumer API allows for updating the Magic Stack module rank order.

For situations where knowing whether to show a module happens later

or if a module (i.e. Safety Check) may change it's specific module

type after an async check, there needs to be a way to clearly

indicate the update that needs to happen. Modules still need to

subsequently call their feature-specific consumer API calls to send

up the view configs, but that will be hopefully be folded into this

API in the future.

entry.title: Add encoding and newline to open calls
entry.content:
For maximum portability the Chromium Python style guide recommends using

newline='' when writing text files (to avoid Windows-style line endings)

and encoding='utf-8' for reading and writing text files. This change

updates testing/unexpected_passes_common to follow this convention.



There are no known problems with this particular set of open calls.

This change is being done for preventive maintenance, and to set a

good example for anybody who copies this code.



The encoding may be unneeded when opening os.devnull, but using it by

default is still a reasonable idea.



Bug: 1418846

entry.title: Transfer system print dialog settings to Print Backend service
entry.content:
Linux and macOS platforms are not yet able to display the system print

dialog from the Print Backend service. In these cases the dialog is

still invoked from the browser process. This requires that the user

settings specified must be collected and then transferred to the

Print Backend service so that the rest of the print pipeline can still

be performed out-of-process.



The nature of such data is platform specific. Encapsulate the data

in a dictionary value for transfer to the service. Mojom validation

ensures that the data passes at least basic expectations for the number

and type of entries in the dictionary.



Test: System print (Print Preview and direct) for both Linux and macOS

Low-Coverage-Reason: https://crbug.com/1451540, https://crbug.com/1463045

entry.title: [ImprovedDownloadWarnings] Change width of download item cards
entry.content:
The width of the item cards was made more dynamic in crrev.com/c/4817533

which also changed the maximum width of the cards to 960px. Since

we landed the unrelated change crrev.com/c/4775841, the URL displayed

for each download is shorter, taking up less horizontal space on the

card, so the wider 960px looks bad now (too much blank space).



This restores the maximum width of the card to 680px, which it was

before the previously mentioned width change. The effect of the two

changes together is to make the width scale dynamically when the window

is narrower, with no change to the maximum width of the cards.

entry.title: Chrome for Testing: Use Google Chrome policies instead of Chromium ones
entry.content:
CfT is initially based on Chromium, however it is meant to get as closer

to Google Chrome as possible over time.



This is one of the post-MVP features documented on the design doc:

https://goo.gle/chrome-for-testing#bookmark=id.28gjo3kyn4oy



Use "/etc/opt/chrome/policies" instead of "/etc/chromium/policies".



Fixed: 1472226

entry.title: snap-group: Do not show window cycle view with one snap group
entry.content:
Follow the behavior pattern of window cycle with free-form windows

only, the window cycle view will not show if there is only one window.

With the existence of snap group, we should also not show window

cycle view if there is only one snap group available. This cl updates

the logic to accommodate for this base case.



Fixed: b/294927763

Demo: http://b/294927763#comment3

causes confusing sandbox errors that are not easily diagnosed.



This CL adds an explicit CHECK to prevent this from happening in

a browser test initialization.



This was tested manually but is non-trivial to write automated tests

for this, as browser tests don't support death tests.

entry.title: webauthn: handle the iCloud Keychain non-credentials case better.
entry.content:
If Chromium doesn't have permission to enumerate credentials in iCloud

Keychain it still shows the option. When the user clicks the option

they'll be prompted for permission if this is the first time. If they

grant that permission, then we can know more and it might be the case

that the request should never have gone to iCloud Keychain.



In 5bad30af3f, the code was updated to filter requests where permission

was granted, but we couldn't do anything if permission was not granted.

However, since we're targeting macOS 13.5, there's an API parameter

that does what we need, even if it's not in the 13.3 SDK that we're

using yet.



With that parameter, we can avoid needing that logic and also handle the

case where we don't have permission.



Bug: 1439987

Change-Id: If978adabe03c27e535cfb9254576ebc328f2ba21

entry.title: Printer settings: Add new printer querying logic
entry.content:
- This CL updates the existing logic for when Printer Settings queries

saved printer for status

- Below is the logic used for determining the delay between printer queries

+--------------------+------------------+----------------+-------------+

| Time Settings open | # Saved printers | Error printers | Non-error printers |

+--------------------+------------------+----------------+-------------+

| < 2 min | <= 3 | 10 - 15 sec | 25 - 30 sec |

+--------------------+------------------+----------------+-------------+

| < 2 min | > 3 | 25 - 30 sec | 60 - 80 sec |

+--------------------+------------------+----------------+-------------+

| > 2 min | n/a | 45 - 60 sec | 60 - 80 sec |

+--------------------+------------------+----------------+-------------+

| > 5 min | n/a | No query | No query |

+--------------------+------------------+----------------+-------------+



- The existing browser test `SavedPrintersStatusPolling` was removed

since it was not properly testing printer querying with the timers.

b/298474359 is tracking this issue.



Bug: b:278621575

Tests: MANUAL testing

entry.title: [Test Automation] Allow named elements with ContextMode::kAny
entry.content:
This is already the default "under the hood" implementation for

an InteractionSequence::Step where a named element is used. However,

previously, any attempt to set the context (even to kAny) after an

element name was specified would cause a CHECK().



This change makes it easier to create custom test verbs that take an

ElementSpecifier and which would like to set context to kAny.

Previously, to avoid the CHECK the custom verb function would have to

check which thing was in the specifier and then conditionally add the

context condition.

entry.title: [Copyright] Fix copyright headers in Chromium.
entry.content:
This CL updates copyright headers in /ui

to the current format:



// Copyright $year The Chromium Authors

// Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style license that can be

// found in the LICENSE file.



Generated with:



./tools/git/mffr.py -g "*.cc" -g "*.h" -g "*.mm" -g "*.py" -g "*.js" -g "*.java" -g "*.mojom" -g "*.xml" -g "*.jinja" -g "*.gn" -g "*.gni" -g "*.star" -g "*.icon" -g "*.ts" -g "*.css" -g "*.json" -g "*.html" -g "*.proto" -g "*.idl" -g "*.pins" -g "*.yml" -g "*.sh" 'Chromium Authors\. All rights reserved\.' 'Chromium Authors'



Additional manual fixes were made to files that have extra "(C)"

strings, or where line breaks were wrong.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=abigailbklein@google.com, alexbn@chromium.org, dfried@chromium.org, fangzhoug@chromium.org, thomasanderson@chromium.org, wenyufu@chromium.org

entry.title: [iOS] Add individual "Hide this Item" options to overflow menu
entry.content:
This CL adds individual Hide X options to the overflow menu context

items. As this requires lots of new strings, the strings themselves aren't in this CL but will be added next. As the items on the main

menu can now be changed while the menu is visible, this CL also

encloses those changes inside a SwiftUI withAnimation: block, so

these changes are animated.



While implementing this, I also discovered 2 issues, that are also

fixed:

1. The current code for positioning the destinations cares about the

bottom position. This means that if none of the items have 2 lines of

text, the whole row shifts down. The new layout positions the top of

the destinations, so this no longer happens.

2. The sheet controller's supported detents were added/removed

without using an animation block.



https://drive.google.com/file/d/194nALKb5opGzlPbgYOupsXXBXSve6aEp/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-HbKV1QVvnDuL08mH6wzqtw



Bug: 1463959, 1477431

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4827568

entry.title: snap-groups: Refactor resizing to SplitViewDivider
entry.content:
No functional change. This refactors common resizing code shared by

tablet mode split view and Snap Groups to SplitViewDivider.



This intends to leave tablet-specific resizing in SplitViewController,

e.g. performant resizing and DividerSnapAnimation.



Note that this still relies on SplitViewController to update

`divider_position_` to calculate the divider bounds. This will be fixed

in b/296935443.



Test: existing

Fixed: b/294579274

Change-Id: Ieb32f6bf573d1bfae36d860b072d9b42ecc6638e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4798384

Commit-Queue: Sophie Wen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1191538}

entry.title: Revert "interactive_ui_tests: use temporary ui::ResourceBundle for screen creation"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5931e820edea2bae56aaca04dea881e521545437.



Reason for revert: Suspect causing multiple test failed on Linux Tests (dbg)(1)

first failure:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(dbg)(1)/115562/overview



Original change's description:

> interactive_ui_tests: use temporary ui::ResourceBundle for screen creation

>

> At least on Linux X11, views::test::TestDesktopScreenOzone::Create() may

> try to retrieve a localized string for "Built-in display" after [1].

> But screen creation happens early for interactive UI tests since [2], at

> least before ChromeFeatureListCreator::ConvertFlagsToSwitches() which

> assumes ui::ResourceBundle is not initialized. This is causing the crash

> below for all interactive UI tests on Linux X11, which this CL fixes by

> temporarily initializing ui::ResourceBundle during screen creation.

> See crbug.com/1457129 for details.

>

> [24841:24841:FATAL:resource_bundle.cc(357)] Check failed: g_shared_instance_ != nullptr.

> #0 0x5585747ceee2 base::debug::CollectStackTrace()

> #1 0x5585747b6213 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace()

> #2 0x5585746ab79d logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage()

> #3 0x5585746ac2ee logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage()

> #4 0x558574692437 logging::CheckError::~CheckError()

> #5 0x558574bd6075 ui::ResourceBundle::GetSharedInstance()

> #6 0x558574bc0a18 l10n_util::GetStringUTF8()

> #7 0x5585758fddc1 ui::BuildDisplaysFromXRandRInfo()

> #8 0x5585758fb539 ui::XDisplayManager::FetchDisplayList()

> #9 0x5585758fb449 ui::XDisplayManager::Init()

> #10 0x55856dd0e34c ui::X11ScreenOzone::Init()

> #11 0x55856d09ed3d views::test::TestDesktopScreenOzone::Create()

> #12 0x558572c7ec70 InProcessBrowserTest::SetScreenInstance()

> #13 0x558572c7e44f InProcessBrowserTest::SetUp()

> #14 0x55856d24c5f2 testing::Test::Run()

> #15 0x55856d24d865 testing::TestInfo::Run()

> #16 0x55856d24e337 testing::TestSuite::Run()

> #17 0x55856d25cf07 testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests()

> #18 0x55856d25c9ff testing::UnitTest::Run()

> #19 0x5585746730ec base::TestSuite::Run()

> #20 0x558572c5eddb ChromeTestSuiteRunner::RunTestSuiteInternal()

> #21 0x55856cc79be4 InteractiveUITestSuiteRunner::RunTestSuite()

> #22 0x558572c5f069 ChromeTestLauncherDelegate::RunTestSuite()

> #23 0x558573d7b9ab content::LaunchTestsInternal()

> #24 0x558572c5f325 LaunchChromeTests()

>

entry.title: Remove base::StringPieceHash
entry.content:
Now that base::StringPiece is std::string_view, std::hash supports it

directly and we don't need to manually pass in a base::StringPieceHash.



I haven't replaced references from base::StringPiece to

std:string_view yet as doing that consistently is a much larger effort

and it seemed odd to leave inconsistencies within a single file or

folder.

entry.title: [Extension GAR] Fix focus on ghost element when extension removed
entry.content:
For ChromeVox on ChromeOS, after an extension has been uninstalled, the

element that's focused may be the uninstalled extension's remove button

which should no longer exist. This CL adds a fix where after an

extension has been uninstalled from chrome://extensions, focus goes to:

- the extension that was at the same index as the uninstalled

extension (remove button if it exists, otherwise details button)

- the search bar if no more extensions exist (will still focus there

if there are chrome apps).



^The search bar was chosen as a more consistent/stable place to focus

after an extension is uninstalled if a suitable element to re-focus

cannot be found.



Bug: 1416324

entry.title: Reorder user eligibility checks in Welcome Tour.
entry.content:
We are currently seeing a large number of `kUserNewnessNotAvailable`

prevention reasons being recorded in metrics. This is likely due to

the cross-device newness check preceding other user eligibility checks.



This CL reorders eligibility checks so that we (hopefully) get better

recording of prevention reasons; users who are known to not be new locally shouldn't record `kUserNewnessNotAvailable` since such users do not go through OOBE and so the unavailability of cross-device newness is

expected.



Bug: b:293200505

Change-Id: I0487bdec5a52279717b8478038117f4de88583f4

entry.title: Guarantee applicationDidRegisterWithAPNS is called on UI thread
entry.content:
didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken is a callback

called by the operating system to pass back the device's APNS token

Chrome requested. We are seeing some crashes whereby the

ApplicationContext is being accessed on the wrong thread (i.e.

non-UI), suggesting that we don't have a guarantee re: which

thread the operating system will call

didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken on. This CL

explicitly posts applicationDidRegisterWithAPNS to the UI thread

to ensure the ApplicationContext is accessed on the correct

thread.



Bug: 1476262, 1476331

Change-Id: Ie754330d1a12dec2f3dd1fdb016061625697f8cc

entry.title: graphite: Support WebGL/WebGPU interop with Dawn Vulkan
entry.content:
Add a GLTexturePassthroughFallbackImageRepresentation that does CPU

readback and upload to/from SkBitmaps.



Extract DawnFallbackImageRepresentation to its own file and change its

name to match other representations.



When Graphite is using Dawn Vulkan, WrappedGraphiteImageBacking will

use the fallback GL and Dawn representations.



This is quite slow, but good enough for testing for now.



Also includes minor fixes in GLTextureImageBacking and GLTextureHolder.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix for undo action not working with new omnibox textfield
entry.content:
In iOS 17, undoManager is now seen as a performedAction which means

that when cmd + z is pressed, we get two calls to

[canPerformAction:withSender:]. One for the undo selector and

another for undoManager.



Additionally, in pre-iOS 17, we didn't have any explicit logic for

allowing the undo action which lead to being in a state where the

undo action was dependent on default logic in UIKit.



This CL resolves both situations by explicitly allowing undo. It's

okay to return YES in this case because allowing an undo action

when there's no text is effectively noop. This also only affects

OmniboxTextFieldExperimental and not OmniboxTextFieldLegacy.



Fixed: 1473743

Change-Id: Ibd424d291d0495de61bd5ec8089f2ba2b3f87092

entry.title: Percentage-based Simplified Battery Notifications
entry.content:
- When the Battery Saver flag is enabled, all power notifications will

appear using a percentage-based threshold.



- Low Power/Critical Power notifications used to be time-based or

percentage-based depending if the user was on battery or a usb charger,

respectively. This CL replaces that behavior when the Battery Saver

feature flag is enabled.



- Percentage threshold is controlled via feature parameter for Finch

experimentation.

entry.title: [iOS] Hide sort menu for Follow UI update
entry.content:
The sorting menu should not appear when the Follow UI update is enabled.

The header anchors depend on the sort button, so instead of removing it

entirely, we keep the alpha at 0 like when it's on the Discover feed.



Also disables the Follow UI update flag by default, since this no longer

will be rolled out as a killswitch.

entry.title: [iOS] Show unsynced-data dialog on signout only for interesting types
entry.content:
Followup to crrev.com/c/4807627:

The sign-out flow should only be interrupted by this dialog if there is

unsynced data that the user is likely to care about - i.e. explicitly

user-added items like bookmarks or passwords, but not e.g. settings or

Sync-internal stuff like DeviceInfo.
